IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: THE RIVERDALE "Y" IS A MULTI-GENERATIONAL AGENCY PROVIDING INFORMAL EDUCATION, LEISURE-TIME ACTIVITIES AND SOCIAL SERVICES TO MEET THE RECREATIONAL, SOCIAL AND CULTURAL NEEDS OF THE JEWISH AND GENERAL COMMUNITIES.
IRS990.MissionDescription: The mission of the Riverdale YM-YWHA is to be the hub that brings together members of the Jewish and wider community. At the Y, individuals and families of all backgrounds and abilities gather to grow, to learn, and to deepen their understanding of themselves and their connections to one another. Rooted in Jewish values, our cultural, social, educational, health and wellness programs offer members of all ages multiple pathways into the richness of our local community life. Through our programs and partnerships, we strive to improve the quality of life in the Riverdale community and celebrate its uniqueness and its diversity.
IRS990.Description: Simon Senior Center - 1000 senior adults registered for program and social services: 400 seniors registered for silver sneakers fitness programming of which 90 use the program daily (quoted as one of the best in the city by the NYC Dept of Aging); 175 seniors are served hot kosher lunch daily; 100 homebound seniors are served weekly Shabbat meals and contacted for reassurance; 90 seniors are transported to the Y and home each day by our buses; 15 seniors participate in our social adult day care program in order to give a rest to caregivers at home; our center is an NYC designated cooling center in the summer.

Activity2.Description: Family & Youth Services (including Summer Camp) - 400 campers attended our four camp programs; 200 K-6 grade students registered in our on-site after school program, with another 150 attending an after school enrichment program run by the Y in a local elementary school; 300 children are registered in our youth basketball league; 250 children are registered in sports and recreation programs including 100 for gymnastics; over 500 participants in different aquatic programs throughout the year; 80 children are registered in nursery school classes; 75 teens are employed by the Y.

Activity3.Description: Cultural Arts -- three live theatre companies reside in and perform at the Y; 80 children participate in Junior Rising Stars, 25 teens participate in Rising Stars and 25 adults participate in the Adult Reperatory Company; 125 shows/events are produced in the theatre each season and seen by 15,000 attendees; 50 children and 10 adults receive 200 music lessons every month.

ActivityOther.Description: HEALTH AND WELLNESS - A FITNESS FACILITY OFFERS EXERCISE OPPORTUNITIES FOR THE HEALTH-MINDED INDIVIDUAL. A VARIETY OF CLASSES IS OFFERED AS WELL. THE AQUATICS FACILITY OFFERS INSTRUCTIONAL AND FREE SWIM FOR ALL AGES. THERE ARE CURRENTLY 1500 MEMBER UNITS WHICH INCLUDE INDIVIDUAL AND FAMILY MEMBERSHIPS.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Description of Intended Use of Endowment Funds:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: THE RIVERDALE YM-YWHA HAS SEVERAL FUNDS, THE PURPOSE OF WHICH ARE DIRECTED BY THE ORIGINAL DONORS WHEN THE FUNDS WERE ESTABLISHED. MOST FUNDS SUBSIDIZE SPECIAL PROGRAMS RUN BY THE AGENCY.
actuarial change in split interest agreement: 35535.
direct cost of special events: 5000. actuarial change in split interest agreement: 35535. Rental expense included in revenue: 39540.
Direct Costs of Special Events: 5000. Rental expense included in revenue: 39540.

FundraiserActivityInformation.Activity: Organizer of Annual Trustee Fundraising Dinner

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Identifier: Procedure for Monitoring Grants in the U.S.:
Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2: The YM-YWHA of the Bronx provides need based and merit based scholarships. For Need Based Scholarships, families ask for assistance and the YM-YWHA then evaluates a family's ability to pay based on wages, family size, and percentage of family budget allocated to YM-YWHA programs. Merit Based Scholarships are for YM-YWHA music instruction programs and are funded from endowment income. As such, the endowment account award guidelines are followed.

Form990ScheduleJPartIII.Explanation: Memberships to the Riverdale YM-YWHA are given to all employees -- worth up to $795 for a family membership. These memberships are nontaxable. In addition, employees receive anywhere from 25-50% discounts on program fees.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The 990 is reviewed by the Audit Committee prior to filing.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Board Members must sign an annual attestation of being in compliance with the policy. Any Trustee having a real or potential conflict of interest on any matter as determined by the President or his designee will not vote or use such Trustees personal influence on the matter and will not be counted in determining a quorum for action on the matter even where permitted by law.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: When hiring key employees, salary comparisons to other UJA organizations are done before making an offer. The only salary discussion involving the Board is that of the Executive Director. The Executive Director does all the hiring and sets salary of other key employees. The executive director's compensation was last determined in December 2009 and the Director of finance's compensation was last determined in September 2009.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The governing documents, conflict of interest policy and financial statements are available to the public upon request.
The process has not changed since the prior year.

Form990ScheduleRPartII.PrimaryActivities: TO COORDINATE COMMON ISSUES AMONG ALL JEWISH AGENCIES LOCATED IN RIVERDALE
